title: Beautiful grape garden inside Agra Fort
review: During my vacation in Agra, I had visited the iconic Agra Fort which is a UNESCO World Heritage site and this beautiful manicured garden which was used to cultivate grapes can be found right in front of Diwan-e-Khas inside the fort complex. This garden is very well maintained with partly green and partly red pattern created using plants. During Mughal era, this garden was the relaxation place for the royal ladies inside the fort. This is a typical Mughal garden of square shape with fountain in the middle. We enjoyed clicking selfies with the garden in the background.

title: Building surrounded by lovely ponds and gardens
review: Anguri Bagh is within the Agra fort complex. It is known for the lily ponds / gardens and niches where candles were placed. It is a different style to many of the other buildings in the complex.

title: Badshah Garden of grapes to prepare fresh wine
review: You will love the land scape design and enjoy gazing . No more grapes now bu you can enjoy sunshine and watch Taj Mahal and river without much crowd and in a relaxed way . You can watch sunset  also .

title: Nice Bagh
review: This was the garden done during the days of king to get the Angoor. The idea behind it to get wine for them from the fresh plants within the fort rather than outside.

title: Taj and river
review: Going to Anguri Bagh if you want to see all sides of Taj Mahal. Watching back of Taj across the river was nice, but I love the front better. It is not that crowded so you will be able to chill there. Besides Taj and river, nothing much to see.

title: Garden of Grapes
review: The Anguri Bagh or the Garden of Grapes is located in the Agra Fort. Though not well-maintained anymore, it is easy to imagine how wonderful it would have been in its heydays.

title: Not Maintained
review: Though this would have been a great view but thanks to the authorities, there is no maintenance. No grass, fountains not working. Please do something to this great place.

title: Impressive within the courtyard
review: This is an impressive building, but within the Agra Fort complex it's one of the least well preserved, and thus tatty, buildings.

title: Great Knot Gardens Before Entering
review: This place seemed to much fewer visitors than other parts of the fort but we found it peaceful. The knot gardens are well laid out and worth a good walk around early in the morning. Water features were not working when we were there. Cooler too.

title: Lovely Garden
review: A very well laid out and planted garden inside the palace of Agra Fort, surrounded by some beautiful buildings.

title: A garden for Royal family
review: Anguri Bagh is garden complex inside the Agra fort palace, Royal family members and queens used to walk into this garden. Though it is not that big, but still it is beautiful and and the only private garden inside the palace where queens and princesses can be there, Though it is currently modified from its original design and is well maintained.

title: Gardens
review: These stunning gardens once a private relaxation area for royal women are inside Agra Fort.  There are elaborate geometric structures and the hamans were in the corner.

title: See This
review: The Anguri Bagh was built for one of the wives of the King. He built three, one for each of his wives and this one is the largest. Lovely carvings in the red sandstone. The flagstones can reflect the heat so on a 40deg day have a hat and lots of water

title: A beautiful courtyard
review: This is one of the prettiest areas of the Agra Fort.  The large courtyard is nicely landscaped and there are a few spots with benches where you can relax.

title: Very Interesting Place
review: There are some places in agra thay make the heart happy that people enjoy wtaching it. This is a one of those. I have gone two times till now. Anguri bagh is amazing. It's very very beautiful. Mist visit place.

title: A GARDEN WITHIN THE AGRA FORT
review: Anguri Bagh is located in front of Jahangir’s Mahal in Agra Fort. It consists of 85 geometrically symmetrical gardens, with various subdivisions and a fountain in the middle and is divided into four quarters (charbagh). It harvested the finest of grapes and flowers during its peak seasons in the Mughal era brought from outside Agra.It was mainly used by the women of the royal household for leisurely strolls.The Bagh is currently not open to the general public.It can be viewed from the roofs of the adjoining palaces.

title: Grape garden
review: Part of the Agra fort. It will take you a few minutes to see it. Originally used for walks by the queens. Apparently, grapes were grown there for the emperor's wine. The gardening was done in a very sophisticated manner. Just walk by it, you will see and understand it without giving it any time.

title: Nice place
review: Anguri Bagh is flanked by the Khas Mahal on east and red sandstone walkways on its other three sides. it was nice place to visit with family and kids.

title: Nice
review: We go to Agra to see the Anguri Bagh. It is very famous in Agra.  It is in red fort of Agra. We recommended me my many friends.

title: Well maintained garden
review: A nice place within the Agra Fort for photo taking and to enjoy the beautiful view of the garden from the double story veranda surrounding the garden.

title: Angie.bagh
review: It's an garden inside Agra fort which was earlier used to have grape vines during Mughal reign enjoy it

title: Visit as Part of the Agra Fort
review: Look out for this attractive garden courtyard, as part of your visit to the magnificent Agra Fort. As the fort is such a large complex and full of history, it is as well to have a guide.

title: Nice place to take a stroll
review: These well tended and colourful gardens are situated inside the Fort in Agra they are in front of the Khan Mahal.

title: Can be skipped, nothing great
review: We were here during our Agra tour. It took us long time to walk to this place. We did not like the place much as no grape trees are here now. All dirty surroundings.

title: Feel the royalty
review: This is a part of the Agra Fort. Used to have grape vines during the Mughal regime. Quite beautiful without them even now.

title: anguri bagh
review: big garden inside agra fort nice an beautiful enjoy with friends an have good pictures and have look on it

title: Well laid out garden
review: Situated in Agra Fort this is a well laid out and maintained garden. Worth wandering round as part of the a visit to the fort but you don't need to spend too much time

title: A beautiful garden inside the Agra Fort
review: This garden can be found in many hindu palaces and there's one at Agra fort too. Incredibly well maintained and a pleasure to look at.

title: We are lucky now to be visiting this area which used to be completely closed for common people.
review: Anguri bagh as the name suggest mean grapes garden. One would get confused that during the time of Moghals, when India was not known to produce lot of grapes specially in Agra, why such a name.

title: Podium Garden of yesteryears
review: Nice podium garden for the grapes for the wine for the king. Home made wine indeed. Must understand this from the guide.

title: Garden of Royals
review: This was the private gardens for royalty. Very well laid out and a nice spot to just walk about and enjoy the sunshine. Do not need a lot of time to see this site.

title: Picturesque
review: Beautiful and picturesque area of the Agra Fort. Would definitely recommend an audio guide to be able to fully appreciate the history of this area of the fort.

title: A piece of history inside agra fort
review: Angoori bagh is a nice piece of greenery and structure inside the Agra Fort. The piece of greenery inside patterned plan looks nice. Visiotors to agra fort should make it a point to visit this place also.

title: Located within Agra Fort
review: Angur stands for Grapes and Anguri Bagh is therefore a grapes garden (Vineyard). One can click a few good pictures.

title: Garden of Grapes
review: Specially designed garden for royal ladies only. Used to grow grapes & different kind of flowers. At that time it was a hard time for the keepers to maintain it.

title: Nice
review: This is within the Agra Fort. It was used to grow grapes for making wine for the king of the palace. Tour through this with the help of a guide.

title: Grape Garden
review: Anguri bag is a part of Agra Fort as this was the private area of royal ladies for relaxation basically all the queens of Akbar. Well maintained inside the fort.

title: Garden inside Agra fort
review: It is a Garden wich leads to Sheesh Mahal ( hall of mirrors ) in the emperor´s time there used to be a wineyard in these gardens. great to take pictures of the great mughal architecture.

title: Like 1001 nights story
review: I think this place better than Taj mahal.it is a fort.magical articheture.but on weekend it was too busy.takes aroubd 2 hrs to visit whole complex.i highly suggest you to visit this place

title: Garden of the Fort
review: This is garden inside the Agra Fort designed for the queens. Well maintained and one can take rest if you are tired in the fort.

title: Garden inside Agra Fort
review: Just a normal garden inside Agra Fort but still maintained. You can have some rest after walking long way in Agra fort.

title: Grape Garden
review: it is one if the garden of the queens, and when you see it you realize how much the king cared about the queen.

title: Family pick nick
review: We have been there today. Its agra fort very very beautiful.

title: A beautiful area with nice landscaped garden
review: Anguri Bagh was an area that was assigned to house the women and the picturesque gardens that are present now was a grape vieyard. This area is surrounded by beautiful buildings, landscaping and gardens and is always shown to tourists when at the Agra Fort.

title: Historic Garden!!!
review: Anguri Bagh Garden is situated in Agra Fort. The place was very beautiful. Must visit place. Its a historic place with beautiful architecture and design.

title: grape garden
review: Aguri bagh or grape garden is a garden inside the agra fort where Jehangir used to grow grapes. It seems the soil was brought from Kashmir for this

title: Garden for the Queens
review: This beautiful landscaped garden within Agra Fort is worth a visit and it is still manicured to perfection. One can well imagine the gardens in the times of the kings and queens who would have enjoyed their relaxing time here.

title: Grape Orchard
review: Grape Orchard, Built by Mughal emperor Shah Jahan. It is adjacent to the Khas Mahal on its east and red sandstone walkways on its other three sides. The garden was used as a private area of relaxation for the ladies of the royal household. In the middle there is fountain. To the northeast of garden are structures which were use as the royal bath houses.

title: Angoori Bagh
review: Angoori Bagh ( Grapes Garden ) is in Red Fort ( Agra Fort ) Agra.

title: Anguri
review: This garden inside the agra fort is full of grapes. It's called Anguri Bagh. Place is most beautiful. Greenery is all around. Once it can be enjoyed.

title: More of a open green space
review: It can not be called a garden but a green area within the Agra Fort area. Historically it was reserved only for women. However, now it is open for all. There is also a fountain in middle.

title: Nice
review: From my understanding, Anguri Bagh is the gardens or green area within the fort. They are nice but pale by comparison to the fort.

title: Beautiful
review: Apparently this translates to "Grape Garden" and is the gardens inside the fort.  It's lovely to see the greenery inside the beautiful complex.

title: simple and cute attraction
review: anguri bagh as the name suggests should be a big bagh type of garden, but technically it is only a decently sized green area and surrounding.  it has nice marble stones along the entire edge and sometimes the fountain looks really pretty and is located inside the agra fort

title: Very beautiful
review: This is a major attraction when doing the golden triangle tour. Very beautiful and totally worth seeing.

title: Beautiful Garden
review: Anguri Bagh is the gardens or green area within the fort. it has nice marble stones along the entire edge and sometimes the fountain looks really pretty and is located inside the Agra fort.

title: Anguri Bagh has no Angoor (Grapes) ;) !!
review: The Anguri Bagh is an integral part of the fort itself. It used to be an area of recreation for the erstwhile queens!

title: Adding charm to the buildings...
review: Though not much of a garden, it adds to the beauty of the buildings around. Who knows, there might have been luxurious vegetation here in its heyday, but now it looks like a glorified lawn.

title: Anguri bagh
review: Anguri bagh is the one of bagh of agra ..this place is beautifull as well as silent..good for people want some peacefull evening with family

title: Mughal design of Garden
review: This place of resembles the design that can be found in the mughal garden elsewhere find in mughal palace

title: nice area in the red fort
review: Built by Shah Jahan in 1637, it consists of stone walkways from the edge to a central fountain, flanked by ornamental gardens in a geometric pattern. It was used as a private garden and relaxation area for the ladies of the fort

title: Garden of Agra fort
review: This one is nice garden inside the agra fort. As it's name suggest it's not garden of grapes. Nice geometric shape garden.

title: Part of Agra Fort.
review: Even though this is listed as a separate venue, its not. Its part of Agra fort and this garden has nothing to do with grapes.

title: Walkway  towards central fountain
review: Walkway made up of marbles , connects to central fountain. Surrounded by some flowers, though not much of a fully garden.

title: Anguri Bagh - Inside Agra Fort
review: Anguri Bagh is actually located inside the premises of the Agra Fort. It is a beautiful garden entrance to which is through ornate archways.

title: INTERESTING PLACE
review: Very interesting history. Needs a good guide to tell the story of the former occupants. Lovely atmosphere in the afternoon

title: Not really a garden
review: It's part of the Agra fort.. It has a fountain in the middle .. It's not  a separate (traditional) garden.. It has history and stories attached to it like the Agra fort

title: a green area
review: really our tour leader could not explain why this area was called Anguri Bagh . in Persian it means vineyard but at present there was only a green area and as i mentioned we could not hear acceptable explanation about the name of this area. anyhow you will see this area in Agra Fort .

title: Beautiful Gardens
review: One of teh many building in the Agra Fort complex. THe many archways provide a welcome shady spot to sit and relax

title: Agra Fort Garden
review: A fantastic garden in Agra Fort.

title: Worth a quick visit
review: This is within the Agra Fort so worth seeing particularly given its historical significance that was built over 350 years ago.

title: Garden for Ladies in Mughal Arena!
review: What i have understood is , Anguri Bagh is Garden for Ladies in Mughal Arena! It is in Agra Fort. Nice architectural works with marbles along with edge. Nice greenish view along with a Fountain. This used by Mughal women for their time pass.

title: A true Ancient view of bagh with lots of stories.
review: Here in this bagh you will come to know so much about the ancient emperors and their life about how they used to live, enjoy their day to day life.

title: GREAT GARDEN
review: Inside agra fort a part of the tour  beautiful mughal ladies garden surrounded on three sides a white cool terrace with rooms

title: Very beatiful
review: when i visited the garden it was so beautiful and was thinking how it was look like of the emperor era.

title: simply beautiful
review: After entering the Agra fort,I came across this fabulous peaceful courtyard garden,it was so beautiful you can sit here and just stare at it,this is a must visit amongst the other beautiful sights inside this fort,so many sights and surprises.

title: Beautiful garden
review: Situated inside the Agra Fort, garden has elaborated geometric patterns, used by the royal ladies for relaxation.

title: Anguri Bagh.. now its only flower
review: Anguri Bagh.. Shahajaan made this as Grape Vinyard.. but now we can see only flowers.. very nice structure ...

title: Agra Fort Harem gardens
review: These cool, beautiful, elegant gardens illustrate the high standards of life provided by the Maharaja for his concubines.

title: Grape shaped garden slots
review: It was a work by King Shah Jahan. He loved the gardens. He might have grown different types of flowering plants in different "angur" shaped areas.

title: Inside Agra Fort
review: Its, nicely maintained and designed and preserved as historical advantage, nice view from top of a balcony

title: The beautiful mughal garden
review: This is one of the beautiful garden in Agra fort.This garden is on the concept of char bagh. There is one beautiful marble tank in the middle  of garden.Grapes were grown in the mughal period to produced the wine.

title: the rear entrance of the fort.
review: lots of walking around to do.   Interesting.  Not a must see though.

title: Well maintened
review: This is a garden inside Agra Fort.. Whole area is developed nicely.. The lobbies are clean and grass is decorated nicely

title: Anguri Bagh agra
review: Anguri Bagh in the Red fort of Agra is an important structure.It is nice place for watch.Please must watch

title: Garden enclosed by buildings
review: As the name suggests, it is a garden enclosed by buildings on all sides. The garden is small and more like a lawn. There are dry fountains within the garden. The buildings enclosing the garden are beautiful. The garden and buildings are well maintained.

title: Beautiful garden, indicator of past grandeur
review: Located within the Agra Fort, next to the lovely Khaas Mahal, is Angoori Bagh. A beautiful green garden, its splendour during Shah Jahan's time can be imagined with the lovely buildings around it and the water channels passing through it. A nice place to click photographs and marvel at the Mughal architecture.

title: Inside Agra fort
review: This is inside Agra fort. it is very well maintained. Take some snaps here as this part of fort really looks good and beautiful.

title: Beautiful Garden
review: This is a beautiful garden inside Agra Fort. This lash-green lawn is pleasing to anybody eyes. However, i had not seen anybody sitting in Anguri Bagh.

title: Plants wise not great, but an amazingly pleasant fragrance
review: The garden is not a haven for different plants, that are pleasing to the eye. But it has an amazingly pleasant fragrance that I assume is given off by one of the plants there.

title: beautiful
review: Nice place. Within the fort itself. Has to be maintained a little bit. This was made for the queens.

title: Special garden for the wifes
review: Shah Jehan built Anguri Bagh or the Garden of Grapes in 1637. It was the principal square of the zenana apartments or the living area of the royal ladies. There was a marble paved platform with a fountain in its centre and the garden itself was divided into compartments in intricate geometrical pattern. As the name suggests, this garden was known for harvesting choicest of grapes and flowers throughout the year.

title: In Agra Fort itself
review: Not sure why this is mentioned as separate site as its in Agra Fort itself. So your visit to Agra Fort will cover this.

title: beautiful
review: there are many places to see in the area. we had a good time here it was fun to photograph all the things.

title: MUGHAL GARDEN WORK
review: During Akbars rule this garden has lot of Grapes and rose flowers.  Out of this rose flowers   were used to take bath .  Even today the art work of the garden is still maintained with no grapes tree.

title: "Beautiful”
review: The garden is very beautiful and well maintained. Its inside the agra fort.The gardens are right near Khas Mahal built by Shahjahan.

title: greenary
review: you don't need extra time because the garden is inside the fort and you stay here with some photos or relaxation the place is good when you are visiting the city.

title: poorly maintained  garden
review: Poor maintenance  of garden.

title: Anguri Bagh
review: If you are visiting the fort, then do have a look at the wonderfully maintained lawns, specially the Anguri Bagh with its intricate geometrical patterns.

title: A Garden inside Agra Fort
review: This Anguri Bagh is situated inside the Agra Fort. The Garden is well maintained. There are four partitions with equal distance and at the center a Fountain like arrangement was there. There was no water in the Fountain while I was there. But people used that Fountain Wall and Steps as a sitting place.

title: well maintained agrden in agra fort
review: Should take a guide for better understanding all historical place.Nice maintained garden in front of Dewani khas.

title: Amazing view
review: I have visited Agra for with friends , Though Fort is very big ans seems to be a strong enough . structure of the fort is very nice . we saw the so many part of fort but among the all we liked the Anguri Bagh very much . Its so attractive and  symmetrical designed which attract to tourist . This Bagh is surrounded by double stories building which is a haram and Shahahan's palace and the sheesh mahal which is not opened for general public . But overall this place is very charming and hope you will like it .

title: Garden where Jehangir's alcohol was prepared
review: This is the place where previously alcohol was made for Jehangir. This place had grapes garden earlier but now has been maintained by ASI.

title: Take a Pic
review: The place in Agra fort which you can not miss out. Keep your camera ready when u reach this place so that make the Agra trip memorable

title: Agra fort
review: Its inside the agra fort. there use to be grape plantation during mughal rule . now its a  beautiful garden

title: Beautiful Garden
review: The Anguri garden is not a separate place to visit. It is inside the Agra fort. You should not miss it. The garden is very beautiful and well maintained by ASI. Take a guide to understand things properly.

title: nice garden
review: West Indian gherkin Bagh (grape garden) is spread in the center of Khas Mahal (private apartments of the emperor). On each side of the palace there are two golden pavilion in which lived the wives and concubines of the emperor. Wide marble garden walkway served to the emperor walks with women yard. Inside not allowed, most likely, nothing interesting has not been preserved.

title: Beautiful Courtyard
review: Of course this is inside the Agra Fort. It's a beautiful courtyard with nice greenery in the garden areas and beautiful white marble. It's pretty crowded so it may be difficult to get great photos but it helps make the Agra Fort experience what it is.

title: Beautiful Garden...
review: The Anguri Bagh as name suggests it was garden of grapes, however layout and landscapes doesn't seem to be. It used to be private garden of rulers.

title: witness of mughal emperors' choice
review: the garden is looking great with pitty grass today - wondering how beautiful and grand it must be then. When all sections were having Graps creppers all over it.

title: a garden outside the kings area in the fort
review: its a must visit in the agra fort do take a good guide so that you could get a clear picture of things

title: Garden of Agra Fort
review: This beautiful Anguri Bagh is a beautiful garden in Agra Fort. The garden used to be vineyard during the Moghul empire and served as the main source of wine making for the palace. The beautiful garden has replace the original Moghul vineyard and maitain beautifully by the authority. The garden located across the harem of the Agra Fort indeed a beautiful sight of Agra Fort.

title: Lovely garden.
review: This is a lovely garden inside Agra Fort. The garden is surrounded by the wives and concubines rooms of the Emperor. It is well maintained and clean.

title: Nice view
review: Should see the splendid space in the Agra Fort. The view from both the sides is excellent. Do not miss to see this place

title: A garden inside Agra fort
review: This is a garden build inside Agra fort in order to create a vineyard inside the fort. Jahangir loved wine a lot, and to prepare wine at his residence, this garden was founded. Currently what you will see, is not as same as it used to be in the past. Only few vine trees are maintained to provid a feeling of the past time. Rest is like normal garden. You will visit this place as a part of Agra fort.

title: Grape garden
review: This internal part of Agra fort. No need to buy tickets separately. The design of the garden also resembles the mughal carpets.

title: Garden inside Agra Fort
review: This is a garden inside agra fort. This garden has been used in multiple purpose. The grapes were used to prepare wine for Jahangir. Grape vines are not anymore available these days, except two or three for showing the public. This place can be covered as a part of Agra Fort.

title: Royal Garden
review: An average garden inside the fort, with no grapes as the name suggests. Is a part of Agra Fort Campus itself.

title: Historcal Garden
review: One of the great attraction in Agra Fort. Fairly maintained and very memorable monument. It is advisable to go to this place during morning time or afternoons during summer.

title: Beautiful
review: Nothing exotic, but loved the way it is designed. Don't see the grapes anymore since the soil doesn't support it but the entire place is beautiful

title: Go!!!
review: WOW, wow, wow, I loved this place. Really nice atmosphere and quite well maintained ... I definitely recommend a visit to this symmetrical building.

title: A Small but maintained Garden
review: The Anguri bagh is in Agra Fort in front of Shahjahan Palace made of white marble.The Anguri Bagh - It houses 85 square, geometrically arranged lush gardens. It is well maintained garden. While our visit two gardenmen were working,maintaining and cutting the grass. It is a part of Agra Fort and you can visit same

title: Beautiful Vineyard and Garden inside Agra Fort
review: As the name suggests, this garden was used to grow grapes for the Royal winery. The Moguls were used to luxuries, and the thought process would have been, why go out to get wines, why not grow our own vineyard?

title: garden of grapes in agra fort
review: Its a garden of grapes for a namesake. It was before, in mughal era. This garden was made and nourished to farm grapes inside the fort. Yet, a beautiful and maintained garden.

title: Simply Wow !!!
review: Yes... This is what you will say when you pass though.. Huge, Well planned and well maintained ... Soothing for eyes even in schorching heat

title: Absolutely fab
review: This is a nice garden inside agra fort only. With marble fort by its side its a sight to visit and experience. Weather. Plays an important role.

title: Good visual delight
review: This is located inside the Fort. This garden was used to cultivate grapes.... but now there are only two grapewines.......

title: Salim's Wine Garden
review: A large rectangular court in front of Khas Mahal is the garden laid out in the Char Bagh pattern with small hexagonal grids of red sandstones. Akbar built it for his son Salim, the future Emperor Jehangir. Grapes were grown in this garden to produce wine for Jehangir, who was very fond of it. Well defined water channels are in place for growing the grapes. The Mughal went at length to get this done as the area in Agra is not suitable for grwing grapes.

title: Agra Fort
review: Stunning architecture very beautiful great views of Taj Mahal albeit a bit smoggy. Helps to employ a good guide, our tour company Sanchari Travels provided us with excellent guide.

title: Kashmir's gift to Agra!!
review: Its one of the gardens in Agra Fort... Jahangir was  so very fond of grape wine and used to have 2-3 cups a day... its said that Mughals got the soil from Kashmir and all possible arrangements were done to set this up!!

title: Anguri Bagh -- Garden of Grapes
review: Build in 1637 by Shah Jahan and called Garden of Grapes. There has a marble paved platform with a fountain in its centre and the garden itself was divided into compartments in intricate geometrical pattern. The garden is known for have grapes and flowers through the year. It is flanked by the Khas Mahal  on the east and red sandstone walkways on its other three sides. Quiet and pleasant place. Open daily from 6 a.m. to 17:30 p.m. There is a ticket for all including Indians and foriegners.

title: Beautiful
review: Our guide had actually advised this place and we loved it. it was definitely interesting and the garden was in full bloom giving us a reason to enjoy more than intended time at the place. our guide was really generous with the stories and facts about the garden.

title: A Beautiful Garden with a Beautiful Palace
review: Anguri Bagh is built by Shah Jahan in the then Mughal era. The garden still looks splendidly eye catching even now. You can get the best view of the garden from the roof of one of the adjoining palaces. Also, I personally recommend a walk on the marbled walkaway in the garden; a little imagination is required to take you the old era and it will thus complete your experience!

title: Good choice to visit
review: It was built by Shah Jahan. It is flanked by the Khas Mahal on its east and red sandstone walkways on its other three sides. It's known for its rich harvests of grapes. The garden here was meant to be a reserved area of relaxation for the royal ladies.

title: A beautiful garden within beautiful palace!!
review: The garden still look beautiful as ever and only slight imagination is required to imagine and see the splendor it must have commanded in older times!!

title: Very soothing view
review: It was a very nice experience visiting this garden. There were grapes all over and as said it was built by shah jahan. Though i won't give it five stars as its mehtab garden that deserves it.

title: Nice Garden
review: As told by our guide Shajaha build this garden and it was full with grape trees which were bought from outside Agra. You can still find some grapes climbers there. You can watch them from a distance in Agra fort and the way to the garden is not opened for general public.

title: Nawabi Bagicha
review: nice place,the mughal architecture gives a royal feeling...in front of it jahanara mahal is also place to watch

title: Quaint little place
review: Anguri Bagh is the small garden where Jahangir grew grapes for his wine. It is a beautiful place in front of the two marble palaces that were built for Jahanara and Roshanara. There is not much to do in Anguri Bagh like the rest of the Agra Fort but one can surely enjoy the contrast of the greenery with the white marble.

title: Angoori bagh-Agra
review: It was good to see anguri bagh in agra. It was a place for relax for mughal kings with their team. Environment was cheerful . Nice place to see such.

title: Grapes Garden
review: This place is really beautiful. Built by Shah Jahan in 1637, Anguri Bagh is flanked by the Khas Mahal on its east and red sandstone walkways on its other three sides. Anguri Bagh was known for its rich harvests of grapes and flowers

title: nice garden
review: inside the agra fort in front of chambers of shahjahan and mumtaz earlier times grapes would be grown as emperor was fond of drinking wine now bit of flowers grown

title: Nice quiet gardens!
review: The gardens are right near Khas Mahal built by Shahjahan for his daughters. Got to love the love for symmetry. It is a nice quiet place to take a break as you walk around the fort.

title: grape garden
review: This garden is in front of Khas palace. This garden is well maintained. In this garden design looks like a carpet knotting.  And photograph of Khas mahal comes beautiful if taken from the side of Anguri garden.

title: They could do better !
review: This is situated right in the middle part of the Agra Fort main building area, but unfortunately management not doing enough to keep this look like a bagh (Garden), during April despite heat , if flowers can bloom in my little home garden,i am sure they can mange to keep the flowers blooming in this place as well.It was sad and dis appointing to see a Bagh without flowers.

title: Can't have anything better than this!!!!
review: How Royal it is... There isn't anything better than having such a big garden with fountains and running waters right in front of your door...

title: Beautiful gardens!
review: Definitely worth a stop if you're in Agra Fort. The gardens look like a jigsaw puzzle of purple and green divided by red bricks. It's really neat and makes a great photo!

title: nice garden within the Agra walls
review: What is most striking about this beautiful garden is the care and the symmetry with which this garden is maintained, rather large balconies you can admire it from coming out of the rooms in the building in marble placed around it. A place of peace and tranquility and as I said great attention to detail, this is another wonderful attraction of many inside the Agra Fort. Absolutely not to be missed.

title: Ornamental Garden
review: These are the ornamental gardens in Shah Jihan's Khas Mahal. White marble paths separate finely manicured plant beds. Look out for former fountains and a bathing pool. The name means Grape Garden.

title: good time spend place
review: this is like a garden Built by Shah Jahan in 1637, Anguri Bagh is flanked by the Khas Mahal on its east and red sandstone walkways on its other three sides. As the name suggests, Anguri Bagh was known for its rich harvests of grapes and flowers and was also the central area of the zenana. The garden was meant to be a private area of relaxation for the royal ladies. you can have a look over here and spend a good time

title: More Wine please
review: It was here that Akbar grew various kinds of grapes for making local wine in the palace. Fiction has it that he even had ice to go with the wine .....and ice was only for emperors, not commoners ! So next time you slip in some ice in your cola, remember you are no less than an emperor.

title: Grape Garden
review: This is the grape garden part of the Agra Fort. It was constructed by Shah Jahan in 1637 and divided into geographical shapes within the square of the private ladies apartments.

title: Bagh-e-Mai
review: The garden infront of the Khas Mahal (Palace) was the place where the grapewines were all around. It has a small pool in the middle and the way it is preserved by the Deptt. is excellent. The view of the Khas Mahal with the Garden enhances it's beauty.

title: wines
review: Kinfg zanhagir was alcholic so his servants brought the soi from kashmeer to grow the grapes here. and these serbants made best wine for the king. and also the design in which grape garden is built that is very beautiful and that design is very popular on Indian carpets and can be seen at different store at Agra

title: Rich History
review: Located within the premises of Agra Fort, the anguri bagh or the grapes garden is surely a site worth seeing. There have been contradictory views regarding the history of Jehangir being alcoholic but nevertheless the garden was made for the purpose of making wine. The dungeons are located just beside the garden and you can get some good shots from the fountains located nearby.

title: Grapes Garden
review: In my lingo, grape known as anggur. It is situated infront of the Khas Mahal. It is a garden facing to the pavillions of Princess Jahanara and Roshanara, has its lily-pools and candle niches. The legend tells in the ancient time, the soil for this garden was brought from Kashmir.

title: Beautiful grape garden inside Agra Fort
review: During my vacation in Agra, I had visited the iconic Agra Fort which is a UNESCO World Heritage site and this beautiful manicured garden which was used to cultivate grapes can be found right in front of Diwan-e-Khas inside the fort complex. This garden is very well maintained with partly green and partly red pattern created using plants. During Mughal era, this garden was the relaxation place for the royal ladies inside the fort. This is a typical Mughal garden of square shape with fountain in the middle. We enjoyed clicking selfies with the garden in the background.

title: Taj and river
review: Going to Anguri Bagh if you want to see all sides of Taj Mahal. Watching back of Taj across the river was nice, but I love the front better. It is not that crowded so you will be able to chill there. Besides Taj and river, nothing much to see.

title: Garden of Grapes
review: The Anguri Bagh or the Garden of Grapes is located in the Agra Fort. Though not well-maintained anymore, it is easy to imagine how wonderful it would have been in its heydays.

title: Not Maintained
review: Though this would have been a great view but thanks to the authorities, there is no maintenance. No grass, fountains not working. Please do something to this great place.

title: Nice Bagh
review: This was the garden done during the days of king to get the Angoor. The idea behind it to get wine for them from the fresh plants within the fort rather than outside.

title: Badshah Garden of grapes to prepare fresh wine
review: You will love the land scape design and enjoy gazing . No more grapes now bu you can enjoy sunshine and watch Taj Mahal and river without much crowd and in a relaxed way . You can watch sunset  also .

title: Building surrounded by lovely ponds and gardens
review: Anguri Bagh is within the Agra fort complex. It is known for the lily ponds / gardens and niches where candles were placed. It is a different style to many of the other buildings in the complex.

title: Beautiful grape garden inside Agra Fort
review: During my vacation in Agra, I had visited the iconic Agra Fort which is a UNESCO World Heritage site and this beautiful manicured garden which was used to cultivate grapes can be found right in front of Diwan-e-Khas inside the fort complex. This garden is very well maintained with partly green and partly red pattern created using plants. During Mughal era, this garden was the relaxation place for the royal ladies inside the fort. This is a typical Mughal garden of square shape with fountain in the middle. We enjoyed clicking selfies with the garden in the background.

title: Impressive within the courtyard
review: This is an impressive building, but within the Agra Fort complex it's one of the least well preserved, and thus tatty, buildings.

title: Great Knot Gardens Before Entering
review: This place seemed to much fewer visitors than other parts of the fort but we found it peaceful. The knot gardens are well laid out and worth a good walk around early in the morning. Water features were not working when we were there. Cooler too.

title: Not Maintained
review: Though this would have been a great view but thanks to the authorities, there is no maintenance. No grass, fountains not working. Please do something to this great place.

title: See This
review: The Anguri Bagh was built for one of the wives of the King. He built three, one for each of his wives and this one is the largest. Lovely carvings in the red sandstone. The flagstones can reflect the heat so on a 40deg day have a hat and lots of water
